text: today's recipe goes out to all my spicy
friends out there I'm making a two chili
chili sauce using dried ancho chiles and
fresh jalapenos I have five dried on
shows that I've just seeded and simmered
in a little bit of water for about five
minutes I'm just gonna drain those they
just need to be pliable and make sure
you take out the seeds and the stems set
that aside for a sec the jalapenos for
jalapenos you want to seed those as well
if you are SuperDuper spicy you can
leave the seeds of one of them in but
you know depending on how spicy your
jalapeno is that can end up being super
spicy some of them are crazy spicy I can
smell that these are pretty spicy it's
already it's tickling me in the back of
my throat if you're super sensitive you
can use a pair of gloves while you're
cutting these up give those a coarse
chop everything's gonna get blended
together in the end so don't be too anal
about this doesn't really matter that
much and then I have four cloves of
garlic those also just need to be very
coarsely chopped toss everything into
your blender the jalapenos and then the
seated on chose and then add a quarter
cup of dark brown sugar 4 tablespoons
3/4 of a cup of ketchup so this is kind
of like a barbecue sauce but it's super
spicy so super delish 3 tablespoons of
molasses adds nice depth of flavor and a
little dark sweetness quarter cup of
apple cider vinegar and a half a cup of
fresh orange juice taste it and make
sure you like it mmm mmm it's really
good it's spicy but not so so spicy that
it's overwhelming now you can just do
whatever you want with it I would put
most of it into a jar and keep it in the
refrigerator today I'm just gonna spread
it on some chicken thighs for roasting
it's great finishing things on the grill
so we can try it I'm gonna brush it on
this chicken and roast it but it would
as I said be great on things on the
grill grilled chicken grilled like
salmon even maybe shrimp definitely pork
a nice all-purpose sort of spicy sauce
you guys are gonna try you're gonna be
like sort of spicy that's the spiciest
thing I ever ate let me know what do you
think these should roast at about 450
degrees for about 25 minutes I probably
should have lined this with some
aluminum foil cuz it's a little sticky
but you live and you learn let's try it
shall we
oh no I got all the good part in one
bite mmm it's delicious it's a little
spicy a little sweet I think you're
gonna really like it make it back to
this today and use it up all summer long
